title: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 Coming This October! - Kinda Funny Games Daily 05.24.22
description:
Go to http://meundies.com/kindafunny to get 15% off your first order.

Tam and Gary join forces to discuss the new Call of Duty getting a release date, the first union at a major US game developer, and more!

Time Stamps - 
00:00:00 - Start
00:08:05 - Housekeeping
A new episode of the Kinda Funny Xcast is UP with SnowBikeMike and one Kahlief Adams talking all about what modern sports games are missing compared to the greats of NBA Street and SSX Tricky.
Screencast is popping off in a BIG WAY this week, later today we will have our reactions to the new Mission Impossible trailer AND our review of chip n’ Dale Rescue Rangers, TOMORROW we will have our Better Call Saul Final Season Part 1 review featuring Jake Baldino, AND this Friday we will have our review of the first two episodes of Obi-Wan Kenobi featuring Saige Ryan. Make sure to catch all of that coming up on YouTube.com/KindaFunny or on your favorite podcast service when you search for Kinda funny Screencast!
Do you like trivia shows? Do you like Family Feud? Well the Gamescast “Bless Who” post show has recently introduced a new game called “Kinda Feudy” that’s a lot like Family Feud but for video games! And we need your help! Over on Blessing’s Twitter is a link to a Google form where you can submit your answers to the Kinda Feudy questionnaire to make your voice heard and help determine the answers. https://twitter.com/BlessingJr/status/1528850715489501184
Thank you to our Patreon Producers: Anonymous & FargoBrady
The Roper Report   -
00:13:20 - Call Of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 Releases October 28 – Steve Watts, GameSpot
00:26:29 - CoD Devs Vote To Form US's First Union At Major Game Company – Eddie Makuch, GameSpot
00:33:50 -  Ad
00:34:55 - Pac-Man Crossover With Fortnite Announced, Launches June 2 – Eddie Makuch, GameSpot
00:43:20 - Final Fantasy XV Was Reportedly Almost Developed By Eidos Montreal – Darryn Bonthuys, GameSpot
00:49:45 - Dragon's Dogma 10-Year Anniversary Site Launches, But Still No Word On Leaked Sequel – George Yang, GameSpot
00:56:32 - Out today
00:58:46 - You‘re Wrong
Tomorrow’s Hosts:Blessing and Janet

Epic Creator Code: KindaFunny

written by eddie mccood um call of duty devs vote to form the us's first union at major a major games company a group of quality assurance testers our call of duty developer raven software has voted to create one of the first video game unions in the united states and at the first and and the first at a major studio in the country 22 staffers at raven software voted and the motion passed 19 to 3. the group known as game workers alliance can now move ahead with contract negotiations with management at activision blizzard it's not immediately clear what specific terms the group is seeking the game workers alliance said in the statement to the verge our biggest hope is that our union serves as inspiration for the growing movement of worker organizing at video game studios to create better games and build workplaces that reflect our values and empower us all we look forward to working with management to positively shape our working conditions and the future of activision blizzard through

and build workplaces that reflect our values and empower us all we look forward to working with management to positively shape our working conditions and the future of activision blizzard through a strong union contract in december 2021 qa workers at raven went on strike some qa testers were later shifted to embedded jobs within other departments at raven labor expert tom smith told polygon that this was nothing more than a tactic to try and stop raven qa from organizing activision blizzard later announced that it would convert 1 100 temporary workers across the company to full time and increase their pay to at least 20 dollars per hour with eligibility for bonuses and benefits a spokesperson for activision blizzard told gamespot we respect and believe in the right of all employees to decide whether or not to support or vote for a union we believe that an important decision will impact the entire raven studios uh of roughly 350 people should not be made by 19 raven employees that's
